normalised: Automotive: Understanding Recent Traffic Regulation Changes

unnormalised: New traffic regulations are now in effect, designed to improve road safety and reduce congestion across India. These changes, announced on 20/07/2024, are crucial for all vehicle owners to understand.
normalised: New traffic regulations are now in effect, designed to improve road safety and reduce congestion across India. These changes, announced on twentieth july two thousand and twenty four, are crucial for all vehicle owners to understand.

unnormalised: One key update involves stricter enforcement of lane discipline, especially on highways like the NH44. Driving in the wrong lane can now attract a fine of Rs. 2000. Secondly, the use of high beams within city limits after 22:00 hrs is strictly prohibited to avoid blinding oncoming drivers.
normalised: One key update involves stricter enforcement of lane discipline, especially on highways like the N H forty four. Driving in the wrong lane can now attract a fine of rupees two thousand. Secondly, the use of high beams within city limits after twenty two hundred hours is strictly prohibited to avoid blinding oncoming drivers.

unnormalised: The Motor Vehicles Act amendment also focuses on reducing noise pollution. Modified exhaust systems that exceed permissible decibel levels will lead to vehicle seizure. Breathalyzer tests are becoming more frequent, especially during festival seasons like Diwali, with increased vigilance expected starting on 01/11/2024.
normalised: The Motor Vehicles Act amendment also focuses on reducing noise pollution. Modified exhaust systems that exceed permissible decibel levels will lead to vehicle seizure. Breathalyzer tests are becoming more frequent, especially during festival seasons like Diwali, with increased vigilance expected starting on first november two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: The IARI (Indian Agricultural Research Institute) in Delhi has collaborated with authorities to research and implement measures to mitigate traffic around its campus during peak hours, from 08:00 hrs to 10:00 hrs. Familiarize yourself with these rules to ensure a safe and compliant driving experience. Remember, responsible driving reflects well on our collective road culture.
normalised: The I A R I (Indian Agricultural Research Institute) in Delhi has collaborated with authorities to research and implement measures to mitigate traffic around its campus during peak hours, from zero eight hundred hours to ten hundred hours. Familiarize yourself with these rules to ensure a safe and compliant driving experience. Remember, responsible driving reflects well on our collective road culture.
